column1: == Origin of the Name and History ==
According to oral tradition the name of the city is linked to the abundance of a fruit similar to the jabuticaba
column2: which was known by the first settlers as only "fruit".  As a result
column3: the place was called Patrimônio das Frutas
column4: later as Carmo do Fructal and today only Frutal.  The first registers mention the arrival of a pioneer Antônio de Paula e Silva in 1835
column5: who settled with his family and slaves on the banks of the Rio Grande.  In 1850 the settlement was declared a "arraial" or village
column6: and in 1858 it was raised to the status of district in the municipality of Uberaba
column7: becoming emancipated in the same year with the name of Carmo do Fructal.  In 1887 it became a city with the name Frutal.
